poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Whoever squawks is dead - two palindromes, Two equilateral, sonic anagrams, One hypothetical, one proleptic. Lead type is movable, time is not. The clock In little ice-age Bruges, Implacable stork - not that one with the snorkel In the Bosch-pink body sock. Who put The phlegm in Flemish, that I get: The merchant taking stock; some yokel, his cotton Smock and dandy stalk of wheat. But where did they get flamingoes, flimflam And flamenco dance To stamp out the fire it started?
